key_points: Donald Trump encouraged supporters to march to the Capitol, leading to a riot.
The mood among the marchers darkened as they approached the Capitol.
Protesters breached the Capitol by ripping open doors and climbing through windows.
Inside the Capitol, rioters vandalized property and looted offices.
The author noted a chaotic and giddy atmosphere among the rioters inside.
Rioters self-described as "peaceful" despite the chaos and vandalism.
Journalists, including the author, faced hostility and aggression from rioters.
There was a notable lack of police presence and response inside the Capitol initially.
Police eventually used force, including pepper spray and percussion grenades, to repel rioters.
The author decided to leave the scene as police began to retake control of the Capitol.
